content: I see a lot of Soldiers coming off of active duty that have 70%-100% disability, but instead of taking care of our finest they put them in the Inactive Ready Reserve to wait out their time. These same Soldiers by regulation if they have more than %70 in more than one area are not supposed to be transferred into a SELRES unit from the IRR. So why can't they discharge these fine Soldiers with honor, is it a numbers game for the Army to keep them on the books? Lets take care of our Finest who have served and not just use them for a numbers game. Give them the medical review prior to release. These Troops have given there all and have physical issues that would prevent many from deploying. Anyone out there that falls into this area? Kyle Premiumboxes

content: Same reason they deploy people with serious medical issues, or at least stop loss them into Rear-D instead of transferring them to Wounded Warrior. Not that some soldiers WANT to be in Wounded Warrior in some units. Okay, those facts I know for a fact. I don't know for a fact what normal procedure is for a medically discharged soldier. They are generally kept on Active until they are given their rating, and then discharged, and tranferred to VA medical. I do know that IRR folks are not covered by military medical - no more than someone would be who was discharged completely if they had finished their Military Service Obligation at separation. (Iraq/Afghanistan vets get six months free coverage, five years for anything service-connected regardless of VA rating.)
